definition: lit. fight tigers with one's bare hands and wade across raging rivers (idiom)/fig. to display foolhardy courage
surname Bao
sudden/violent/cruel/to show or expose/to injure
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
surname Feng
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
bold but not very astute (idiom)
good people are at peace with themselves, (but) there is no rest for the wicked
pinyin: jun1 zi5 tan3 dang4 dang4 , xiao3 ren2 chang2 qi1 qi1
related.word: 君子坦荡荡，小人长戚戚

definition: the courage born of stirred emotions (idiom)
to keep going resolutely despite knowing the task is impossible (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 bu4 ke3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: in peril/facing disaster
resolute and taciturn (idiom)
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
upright and plainspoken (idiom)
How do you catch the tiger cub without entering the tiger's lair? (idiom); Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
pinyin: bu4 ru4 hu3 xue2 , yan1 de2 hu3 zi3

definition: a mantis trying to stop a chariot (idiom)/to overrate oneself and attempt sth impossible/also written 螳臂擋車|螳臂挡车[tang2 bi4 dang3 che1]
a great hero may appear timid (idiom); the really brave person remains level-headed
lit. body made of wood, heart made of stone (idiom)/fig. heartless
not to claim personal credit for achievement (idiom)
succeed or fail, sharp or blunt (idiom); advantages and disadvantages/success and failure/You win some, you lose some.

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
